title: Rihanna makes surprise appearance at London bash
text:
She gave a new interview with US VOGUE this month, offering fans some rare insight into her private life.

And Rihanna continued to delight her admirers when she put in a surprise appearance at the Legado x Faberge x Rome de Bellegarde VIP party, hosted at The Vinyl Factory Gallery in London on Thursday evening.

The superstar, 31, turned up the head in a cool, sportswear inspired look, opting for an all-white theme.

Shine bright: Rihanna put in a surprise appearance at the Legado x Faberge x Rome de Bellegarde VIP party, hosted at The Vinyl Factory Gallery in London on Thursday evening

Rihanna paired her loose jacket with a thigh-skimming miniskirt and matching pointed stilettos.

She carried her essentials in a large clutch bag and matched her shades to the rest of her look.

The Bajan beauty wore her hair pulled back in a tight bun and accessorised with large statement hoops.

The singer participated in a back-and-fourth Q&A with Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour who asked her if she was planning on having a baby soon.

Rihanna seemed thrown off by the question from the 69-year-old British American as she opened up her eyes wide and gasped before giggling.

She then proceeded to answer by saying: 'Uh I don't think about stuff like that but... God's plan.'

'But I look forward to all of the pregnancy rumors after this interview.'

This video was posted along with an accompanying interview for her Vogue cover story where she revealed that though she tries to keep her personal life out of the spotlight, she is 'happy.'

The Diamonds hitmaker has been romantically linked with Saudi businessman Hassan Jameel for over two years.

Party-time: The songstress appeared in high spirits as she headed into the event

Family outing: The singer brought her brother Rorrey Fenty along to the event

She said: 'Yeah, I'm dating. I'm actually in an exclusive relationship for quite some time, and it's going really well, so I'm happy.'

The star also addressed her drive to have children inside the pages of the magazine as she replied: 'Without a doubt.'

Rihanna has seen a 'shift' in her life in recent months and feels like she is finally growing up.
